name: num::fmt::Formatted::<'a>::write

str::<impl str>::len.doc:
Returns the length of `self`.

 This length is in bytes, not [`char`]s or graphemes. In other words,
 it might not be what a human considers the length of the string.

 [`char`]: prim@char

 # Examples

 ```
 let len = "foo".len();
 assert_eq!(3, len);

 assert_eq!("ƒoo".len(), 4); // fancy f!
 assert_eq!("ƒoo".chars().count(), 3);
 ```

str::<impl str>::as_bytes.doc:
Converts a string slice to a byte slice. To convert the byte slice back
 into a string slice, use the [`from_utf8`] function.

 # Examples

 ```
 let bytes = "bors".as_bytes();
 assert_eq!(b"bors", bytes);
 ```

ops::index::IndexMut::index_mut.doc:
Performs the mutable indexing (`container[index]`) operation.

 # Panics

 May panic if the index is out of bounds.

num::fmt::Part::<'a>::write.doc:
Writes a part into the supplied buffer.
 Returns the number of written bytes, or `None` if the buffer is not enough.
 (It may still leave partially written bytes in the buffer; do not rely on that.)

doc:
Writes all formatted parts into the supplied buffer.
 Returns the number of written bytes, or `None` if the buffer is not enough.
 (It may still leave partially written bytes in the buffer; do not rely on that.)
